item.title: AWS Essentials 2019
item.subject: AWS
item.description: Linux Academy's AWS Essentials course is designed for those who want to learn the core services, features, and benefits of AWS, while also gaining valuable hands-on experience. This course covers all the basics, including creating an AWS account, configuring access management; virtual networking, routing, and security; compute, storage, and database services; monitoring and metrics; fundamental cloud/AWS terminology.

item.title: AWS Concepts
item.subject: AWS
item.description: This course is to provide a simple, conceptual introduction to the concepts of Cloud Computing and Amazon Web Services.

item.title: Web Security: OAuth and OpenID Connect
item.subject: OAuth
item.description: While many technical professionals claim to know and understand OAuth, reality often suggests otherwise. Implementing the proper grant types and the required flows while securely protecting your secrets is challenging at best and catastrophic at worst. Fundamentally, professionals often struggle with OAuth because they misunderstand what it is, what use cases it is particularly good and bad at, and how to integrate it smoothly and safely into their systems. In this course, review the basics of OAuth 2.0 and OpenID Connect, and learn how to use them to authenticate your applications. Learn about tokens, scopes, and claims; OAuth flows; common security considerations; and more.

item.title: API Testing and Validation
item.subject: API
item.description: Most API testing doesn't actually test the API. This course shows how to validate your API from the consumer's point of view, testing to confirm that problems experienced by your end users are being solved. Join Keith Casey as he focuses on how to approach API testing by implementing a behavior-driven development model. Keith uses Gherkin to set up a Behat environment so you can see how to write and run your first test. Then, he shows how to build API test requests, including how to introduce variables, authenticate requests, and validate responses. He also covers refactoring tests, establishing system states, using extensions for batch operations, and more.

item.title: Designing RESTful APIs
item.subject: API
item.description: Having a solid understanding of how to correctly build APIs is important for any developer planning on creating websites. In this course, learn how to plan and model your own APIs, and explore the six REST design constraints that help guide your architecture. Keith Casey starts with a simple overview, including advice on identifying the users or "participants" of your system, and the activities they might perform with it. He discusses how to validate your design before you build it, and explores the HTTP concepts and REST constraints needed to build your API. To wrap up, Keith goes over some of the most common API design patterns you may encounter.

item.title: HTTP Essential Training
item.subject: HTTP
item.description: Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP) is one of the most utilized protocols on the internet. In this course, instructor Morten Rand-Hendriksen helps you bolster your understanding of how HTTP works by reviewing fundamental concepts. He begins by explaining what HTTP is, and then covers key terminology and the HTTP flow. He then discusses the request/response pair, HTTP methods, and status messages. To wrap up, he goes over HTTP headers, explaining what they are and how to see them.

item.title: Learning REST APIs
item.subject: API
item.description: Learn the basics of REST APIs. In this course, discover what REST APIs are, why they matter, and how putting them to use can help you build faster, more efficient applications. Review how HTTP and REST APIs relate, explore the six constraints of REST, and learn about HTTP status messages. Learn how to get started with consuming REST APIs to incorporate them into data-driven applications.

item.title: AI For Everyone
item.subject: AI
item.description: Introduction to AI: defined AI, discussed machine learning, what makes valuable data, limitations of machine learning, deep learning and neural networks, what an AI project looks like.

item.title: Crash course in API documentation
item.subject: API
item.description: Compressed introduction to APIs: what are they, components of API documentation, OpenAPI specification, static site generators, reference vs. conceptual documentation, docs as code.

item.title: Java 8 Essential Training
item.subject: Java
item.description: Introductory course on Java programming language. Covers how to set up Java and IntelliJ. Covers basics: variables, values, and expressions; object data types; building, comparing, parsing strings; debugging and excepton handling; loops; passing arguments by reference or value; simple and complex arryas; custom classes; inheritance and polymorphism; Java libraries; Javadoc; JAR files

item.title: Git and GitHub for Writers
item.subject: Git, GitHub
item.description: Introduction to Git and GitHub taught for writers. Covers adding, renaming, deleting, cloning repositories. Also discussed tags, pulls, branches, stashing changes, merging branches, rebasing, gitignore files, and dealing with problems in Git. Touched on documentation in GitHub and other tools like GitBook, Jekyll, or AsciiDoctor.

item.title: Learning Java
item.subject: Java
item.description: Introductory course on Java programming language. Covers how to set up Java and IDE and use JShell. Covers basics: variables and data types, user-defined functions, constructors method, Scanner methods for input, arrays, call by value/reference, program control flow, UML, loops, libraries, debugging, encapsulation, inheritance, interfaces, functional programming, and lambdas.

item.title: Jenkins Tutorial for Beginners
item.subject: Jenkins, Maven
item.description: Introductory tutorials that cover the basics: how to install Jenkins, create jobs, trigger remote builds, integrate with Git and GitHub, create users, install plugins, manage roles, configure system environments, set up for Maven projects, send email notifications, use a pipeline, use slaves/nodes, use multiple branch pipelines, etc.

item.title: Learn Swagger and the Open API Specification
item.subject: Swagger, OAS, API
item.description: Covers how to use Open API Specification (YAML, JSON) files to define and document APIs; Swagger tools to edit files, create documentation, and create SDKs; alternatives to Swagger and OAS.

item.title: Git Essential Training
item.subject: Git, GitHub
item.description: Shows how to use Git to manage changes to source code and text files. Walks through how to install Git, track changes, review edits, compare versions of a file, create branches, merge changes, etc. Also, covers setting up and using a remote repository (GitHub) and collaborating.

item.title: Coding for Writers I: Basic Programming
item.subject: API, Technical writing, JavaScript
item.description: Teaches programming concepts, how to write JavaScript programs, and how to write technical documentation for constants, functions, and enumerations. Aimed at technical writers.

item.title: Intro to JavaScript
item.subject: JavaScript
item.description: Covers how to create interactive websites with basic JavaScript, dynamic HTML, and JSON.

item.title: The Art of API Documentation
item.subject: API, Technical writing
item.description: Covers how to produce API documentation. Third course in series.

item.title: Intro to Web Concepts
item.subject: Web development
item.description: Introduces web development terms and technology. Discusses UX, UI, and tools for building sites. Covers the roles of web development team members.

item.title: Learn API Technical Writing II: REST for Writers
item.subject: API, Technical writing
item.description: Covers how to produce API documentation, focused on REST. Second course in series.

item.title: Learn API Technical Writing: JSON and XML for Writers
item.subject: API, Technical writing
item.description: Covers how to produce API documentation, focused on SOAP. First course in series.

item.title: Intro to Git and GitHub
item.subject: Git, GitHub
item.description: Covers the setup and use of Git and GitHub for version control and collaboration.

item.title: TechComm 201
item.subject: Technical writing
item.description: Teaches soft skills, project management, advanced editing, and tools for technical communication.

item.title: TechComm 101
item.subject: Technical writing
item.description: Teaches the theory and skills needed for technical communication.

item.title: Minimalist Writing for Documentation
item.subject: Technical writing
item.description: Teaches minimalist writing best practices to reduce volume and complexity of writing, improve design, increase reader comprehension, and decrease the cost to develop, produce, and maintain materials.

item.title: easyDITA
item.subject: DITA
item.institution: Society for Technical Communication, Silicon Valley Chapter
item.description: Covers the basics of DITA, the easyDITA software application, and how to use the easyDITA CMS.

item.title: Modern JavaScript: An Introduction
item.subject: JavaScript
item.description: Teaches the basics of JavaScript through various homework assignments.

item.title: WordPress.com Essential Training
item.subject: WordPress, CMS
item.description: Covers how to get up and running with WordPress.com. Includes such topics as posts, pages, profiles, themes, settings, and images.

item.title: Introduction to HTML and CSS
item.subject: HTML, CSS
item.description: Introduces basic and intermediary HTML and CSS.

item.title: Technical Editing Fundamentals
item.subject: Technical editing
item.description: Covers the tools, methodologies, types of editing, and best practices for technical editing.

item.title: Content Management In a Nutshell I
item.subject: Content management, DITA
item.description: Covers how to perform content management analysis, assessment, and audit; how to create a business case; and content modeling using DITA.

item.title: XML Essential Training
item.subject: XML
item.description: Teaches basic XML semantics, syntax, style sheets, schema definitions, and tools.

item.title: Real-World XML
item.subject: XML
item.description: Covers best practices, tools, and implementation of XML formats in real-world situations.

item.title: InDesign CS5: Dynamic Publishing Workflows in XML
item.subject: InDesign, XML
item.description: Explains how to use XML tools to enhance the page design process in InDesign, how to use the Structure pane and Tags panel, how to write code for integration of XML into InDesign and external editors, and how to add dynamic content to pages with XML.

item.title: HTML5: First Look
item.subject: HTML
item.description: Presents a high-level overview of HTML5 in its current state (2011), how it differs from HTML 4, the current level of support in various browsers and mobile devices, and how the specification might evolve in the future.

item.title: CMS Fundamentals
item.subject: CMS
item.description: Gives an overview of CMS solutions (WordPress, Drupal, Joomla). Explains terminology, best practices, content management strategy, and how to evaluate CMSs (hosted/self-hosted, open source/proprietary).

item.title: SharePoint 2010 Getting Started
item.subject: SharePoint
item.description: Reviews the creation and use of SharePoint sites, lists, and libraries.

item.title: CSS2 Essential Training (2003)
item.subject: CSS
item.description: Shows how to use CSS to control layout and the look and feel of web pages.

item.title: CSS for Developers
item.subject: CSS
item.description: Reviews CSS fundamentals: how to format text, images, backgrounds; how to position elements on page; inline and external styles; best practices; and browser support.

item.title: Web Design Fundamentals
item.subject: Web design, Web development
item.description: Reviews web design techniques and technologies, fundamental concepts and terms, best practices, web dev tools, server-side software solutions, content management solutions, and cloud-based solutions.

item.title: HTML5: Structure, Syntax, and Semantics
item.subject: HTML
item.description: Covers HTML5 and its development, new tags and attributes, and how browsers parse and display HTML5 content. Show how to construct an HTML5 document with a header and footer, navigation, content groups, and formatting.

item.title: XHTML and HTML Essential Training
item.subject: HTML
item.description: Covers the structure, block and inline-level tags, floating images, controlling white space, phrase and font markup, tables, and frames for XHMTL and HTML.

item.title: JavaScript Essential Training (2007)
item.subject: JavaScript
item.description: Covers how to work with objects, create buttons and forms, and make rollovers, menus, slideshows, and countdowns.

item.title: Up and Running with InDesign
item.subject: InDesign
item.description: Explains how to design polished multi-page documents for print and electronic output in InDesign. Covers the basics of formatting type, flowing text, placing images, and combining type and graphics.

item.title: JavaScript Essential Training (2011)
item.subject: JavaScript
item.description: Teaches best practices and practical uses for JavaScript that cover syntax; working with the DOM; developing and debugging across multiple platforms, devices, and browsers; how to progressively enhance and gracefully degrade web pages; and how to use JavaScript libraries.

item.title: InDesign CS5 Essential Training
item.subject: InDesign
item.description: Shows how to create new docs with master pages, position text and graphics, prepare docs for print, and export designs as interactive PDF or Flash SWF files in InDesign.

item.title: Visio 2010 Essential Training
item.subject: Visio
item.description: Covers the Visio interface and how to make different types of diagrams in Visio.

item.title: Photoshop CS5 Essential Training
item.subject: Photoshop
item.description: Introduces Photoshop, Adobe Bridge, Camera Raw, and the most efficient ways to perform common editing tasks.

item.title: Foundations of Programming: Fundamentals
item.subject: Programming
item.description: Uses JavaScript to explain core programming syntax, how to write and execute code, how to write module code, and how to debug.

item.title: Foundations of Programming: Object-Oriented Design
item.subject: Programming
item.description: Introduces object-oriented design and terms (abstraction, inheritance, polymorphism, subclass).

item.title: jQuery Essential Training
item.subject: jQuery
item.description: Explains how to use a jQuery library to add advanced functionality to websites.

item.title: HTML5: Document Editing in Depth
item.subject: HTML
item.description: Shows how to create editable content using the document-editing application programming interface (API) in HTML5.

item.title: CSS: Visual Optimization
item.subject: CSS
item.description: Covers how to optimize CSS for easier navigation, organization, and readability. Explains best practices for format, commenting, and TOCs.

item.title: RoboHelp 9 HTML Essential Training
item.subject: RoboHelp
item.description: Teaches the core features of RoboHelp and how to work with RoboHelp pods, save custom workspaces, create new projects, and leverage existing content in other formats, such as Word and PDF documents. Includes tutorials on merging projects, topic formatting, using graphics and multimedia, and using forms and frames.

item.title: Writing in Plain English
item.subject: Technical writing
item.description: Reviews the rules and guidelines for writing in plain English for clarity.

item.title: Foundations of Programming: Web Services
item.subject: Programming
item.description: Defines web services and explores their history and use in distributed computing. Covers transport protocols HTTP and SMTP; messaging formats such as SOAP, ATOM, JSON, and Plain Old XML (POX); and service standards like SOAP toolkits, REST, and OData. Explains how to secure your communications across the web with API keys and other security standards.

item.title: Grammar Fundamentals
item.subject: Technical writing
item.description: Covers the basic principles of grammar, different parts of speech, possessive rules, and the difference between writing vs. spelling out numbers.

item.title: JavaScript
item.subject: JavaScript
item.description: Teaches fundamental programming concepts and how to use them by creating programs with JavaScript. Covers data types, functions, loops, control flow, and objects.

item.title: jQuery
item.subject: jQuery
item.description: Shows how to add interactivity and animations to websites with the jQuery library.

item.title: PHP
item.subject: PHP
item.description: Teaches the server-side language PHP and fundamental programming concepts such as data types, functions, and control flow.

item.title: Command line
item.subject: Command line
item.description: Shows how to use the command line to navigate, access, and modify files and folders on your computer.

item.title: Try Git
item.subject: Git, GitHub
item.description: Reviews basics of Git, including how to initialize a repo and how to add, commit, and push your code to GitHub.

item.title: Ruby
item.subject: Ruby
item.description: Introduces basic programming concepts such as variables, loops, control flow, and object-oriented programming through Ruby.
